intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius schmidii, commonly known as the Schmid's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium schmidii is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
